div.p: Maya Angelou Public Charter School was founded by David Domenici and James Forman Jr. and is the namesake of the renowned poet, author and activist. At Maya Angelou Schools, the key to our success is rooted in building trusting, respectful, and nurturing relationships with each other.

article.class: post clearfix post-11243 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-stories has-post-title no-post-date has-post-category has-post-tag has-post-comment has-post-author cat-224

h2.a: Maya Angelou launches Virtual Learning Plan and Campaign in Response to COVID-19

img.alt: Maya Angelou launches Virtual Learning Plan and Campaign in Response to COVID-19

div.p: On March 11, 2020, in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19), Mayor Muriel Bowser declared both a state of emergency and a public health emergency. During this unprecedented public health emergency, Maya Angelou Schools remains committed to ensuring the well-being of our students and school communities. Find out more information about our virtual plans and additional […]

article.class: post clearfix post-10254 type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-stories category-yalcnews has-post-title no-post-date has-post-category has-post-tag has-post-comment has-post-author cat-224 cat-221

h2.a: NBC4 Features Hoop House on News

div.p: On Thursday, July 18, 2019, Urban Farm at Maya was featured on NBC Washington’s morning and afternoon noon segments on yesterday. We recently marked the one year anniversary of the Urban Farm and this was a perfect way to celebrate and share the important work that we do at Maya Angelou Schools and the See […]

a.p: The Maya Angelou Schools on Spring Break and will return for distance learning on Monday, April 20, 2020. The See Forever Foundation and Maya Angelou Schools administrative offices will close for Spring Break on… https://www.instagram.com/p/B-7QPjNnspT/?igshid=11gc3hgrbo0i0

pum-container popmake theme-7068 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium

h3.span: To exercise an abundance of caution and in keeping with the decisions of our sister districts—Maryland and DCPS—the Maya Angelou Schools will be closed and reopen on Monday, April 27, 2020. Please continue to practice those things that will help keep you safe that includes washing hands frequently with soap and water, using hand sanitizer when soap and water are not available, and keeping your hands off of your face. Additional information regarding our instructional and meal distribution plan and helpful resources can be found here.
